title: Veggie Rice Balls

description: These delicious Veggie Rice Balls are a perfect blend of crispy bites and nutritious veggies, making them an irresistible snack for both kids and adults. Easy to prepare and packed with flavor, they are sure to become a family favorite.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and prepare a baking sheet by lining it with parchment paper.
Mash the steamed carrots and broccoli in a large bowl until small chunks remain.
Mix in the beaten egg, shredded white cheddar cheese, garlic powder, salt, and freshly cracked black pepper.
Add the cooked white rice to the veggie blend and mix until fully combined.
Form the mixture into uniform balls using a cookie scoop, about 1 tablespoon size.
Place the rice balls onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 25-27 minutes until golden brown.
Cool slightly before serving, making them perfect for little hands.
tips: For an extra flavor boost, serve these rice balls with a side of marinara sauce. Adjust the seasoning to suit your taste preferences.

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made these Veggie Rice Balls for my kids; their faces lit up with joy as they took their first bites. It was a simple way to sneak in some veggies while making snack time fun!

• Main ingredient: Steamed carrots and broccoli provide essential nutrients and vibrant color. You can substitute with sweet potatoes or peas for variety.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Garlic powder adds depth of flavor; fresh minced garlic can be used for a stronger taste.
  • Supporting ingredients: White cheddar cheese binds the mixture and adds creaminess; feel free to use your favorite cheese.

Preparation:
Preheat your oven and prepare your baking sheet. Mash the veggies in a large bowl.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Combine all ingredients, form into balls, and bake until golden brown.
Finishing Touches:
Allow to cool slightly before serving to ensure they hold their shape.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure the rice is fully cooked and cooled before mixing to prevent sogginess.
  • A common mistake is overbaking; keep an eye on them to achieve the perfect golden brown.
  • They are ready when they are golden and firm to the touch.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days and reheat in the oven for best results.

structured_content.content: Sharing these Veggie Rice Balls with family during movie nights has become a cherished tradition in our home. They are not just a snack; they are a way to connect and enjoy good food together.
Consider adding herbs like parsley or basil for an extra layer of flavor. You can also experiment with different cheeses or add spices like paprika for a kick.
These rice balls pair wonderfully with a side of marinara sauce, a fresh salad, or even a yogurt dip for a refreshing contrast.
For a gluten-free version, use quinoa instead of rice. You can also make them vegan by substituting the egg with a flaxseed meal mixture and using plant-based cheese.
